info.title: Azure Machine Learning Services
info.description: These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Workspace resources.

This method must validate and forward the call to NRP.

get.summary:
Called by Client (Portal, CLI, etc) to get available "private link resources" for the workspace.
Each "private link resource" is a connection endpoint (IP address) to the resource.
Pre single connection endpoint per workspace: the Data Plane IP address, returned by DNS resolution.
Other RPs, such as Azure Storage, have multiple - one for Blobs, other for Queues, etc.
Defined in the "[NRP] Private Endpoint Design" doc, topic "GET API for GroupIds".

200.description: The request was successful; the request was well-formed and received properly.

AADAuthTypeWorkspaceConnectionProperties.description: This connection type covers the AAD auth for any applicable Azure service

AccountKeyAuthTypeWorkspaceConnectionPro.description: This connection type covers the account key connection for Azure storage

AllowedContentLevel.description: Level at which content is filtered.

ApiKeyAuthWorkspaceConnectionProperties.description:
This connection type covers the generic ApiKey auth connection categories, for examples:
AzureOpenAI:
    Category:= AzureOpenAI
    AuthType:= ApiKey (as type discriminator)
    Credentials:= {ApiKey} as Microsoft.MachineLearning.AccountRP.Contracts.WorkspaceConnection.ApiKey
    Target:= {ApiBase}
            
CognitiveService:
    Category:= CognitiveService
    AuthType:= ApiKey (as type discriminator)
    Credentials:= {SubscriptionKey} as Microsoft.MachineLearning.AccountRP.Contracts.WorkspaceConnection.ApiKey
    Target:= ServiceRegion={serviceRegion}
            
CognitiveSearch:
    Category:= CognitiveSearch
    AuthType:= ApiKey (as type discriminator)
    Credentials:= {Key} as Microsoft.MachineLearning.AccountRP.Contracts.WorkspaceConnection.ApiKey
    Target:= {Endpoint}
            
Use Metadata property bag for ApiType, ApiVersion, Kind and other metadata fields

step.description: The minimal incremental between allowed values for capacity.

allowedValues.description: The array of allowed values for capacity.

model.description: Model used for the endpoint deployment.

ConnectionAuthType.description: Authentication type of the connection target

CustomKeysWorkspaceConnectionProperties.description:
Category:= CustomKeys
AuthType:= CustomKeys (as type discriminator)
Credentials:= {CustomKeys} as Microsoft.MachineLearning.AccountRP.Contracts.WorkspaceConnection.CustomKeys
Target:= {any value}
Use Metadata property bag for ApiVersion and other metadata fields

EncryptionStatus.description: Indicates whether or not the encryption is enabled for the workspace.

source.description: Optional. Deployment model source ARM resource ID.

failureReason.description: The failure reason if the creation failed.

keys.description: Dictionary of Keys for the endpoint.

fineTune.description: The datetime of deprecation of the fineTune Model.

inference.description: The datetime of deprecation of the inference Model.

isDefaultVersion.description: If the model is default version.

version.description: Optional. Deployment model version. If version is not specified, a default version will be assigned. The default version is different for different models and might change when there is new version available for a model. Default version for a model could be found from list models API.

connectionIds.description: The list of ARM id for the connection support this SKU.

deprecationDate.description: The datetime of deprecation of the model SKU.

name.description: The name of the model SKU.

usageName.description: The usage name of the model SKU.

count.description: The count value of Call Rate Limit.

renewalPeriod.description: The renewal period in seconds of Call Rate Limit.

rules.description: The call rate limit for the model.

dynamicThrottlingEnabled.description: If the dynamic throttling is enabled.

nextLink.description: The link to the next page constructed using the continuationToken.  If null, there are no additional pages.

associatedResourceId.description: Byo resource id for creating the built-in model service endpoints.

failureReason.description: The failure reason if the creation failed.

location.description:
Location of the endpoint.
Since input dto and when parse endpoint resource share the same contract
this Location field is just for parse the endpoint resource info
we won't let customer specify the endpoint resource location since we will create it the same location as workspace

shouldCreateAiServicesEndpoint.description: Whether the proxy (non-byo) endpoint is a regular endpoint or a OneKeyV2 AI services account endpoint.

IPRule.description: Contains an IPv4 address range in CIDR notation, such as '124.56.78.91' (simple IP address) or '124.56.78.0/24' (all addresses that start with 124.56.78). Value could be 'Allow' or  'Deny'.

value.description: An IPv4 address range in CIDR notation, such as '124.56.78.91' (simple IP address) or '124.56.78.0/24' (all addresses that start with 124.56.78). Value could be 'Allow' or  'Deny'.

userAssignedIdentity.description: UserAssignedIdentity to be used to fetch the encryption key from keyVault

identityClientId.description:
Currently, we support only SystemAssigned MSI.
We need this when we support UserAssignedIdentities

PrivateEndpointServiceConnectionStatus.description:
Connection status of the service consumer with the service provider
Possible state transitions
Pending -> Approved (Service provider approves the connection request)
Pending -> Rejected (Service provider rejects the connection request)
Pending -> Disconnected (Service provider deletes the connection)
Approved -> Rejected (Service provider rejects the approved connection)
Approved -> Disconnected (Service provider deletes the connection)
Rejected -> Pending (Service consumer re-initiates the connection request that was rejected)
Rejected -> Disconnected (Service provider deletes the connection)

WorkspaceConnectionOAuth2.description:
ClientId and ClientSecret are required. Other properties are optional
depending on each OAuth2 provider's implementation.

clientId.description: Client id in the format of UUID

refreshToken.description:
Required by GoogleBigQuery, GoogleAdWords, Hubspot, QuickBooks, Square, Xero, Zoho
where user needs to get RefreshToken offline

tenantId.description: Required by QuickBooks and Xero connection categories

username.description:
Concur, ServiceNow auth server AccessToken grant type is 'Password'
which requires UsernamePassword

metadata.description: Store user metadata for this connection

securityToken.description: Optional, required by connections like SalesForce for extra security in addition to UsernamePassword

publicNetworkAccess.description: Whether requests from Public Network are allowed.

serverlessComputeSettings.description: Settings for serverless compute in a workspace

sharedPrivateLinkResources.description: The list of shared private link resources in this workspace.

tenantId.description: The tenant id associated with this workspace.

v1LegacyMode.description: Enabling v1_legacy_mode may prevent you from using features provided by the v2 API.

workspaceId.description: The immutable id associated with this workspace.

v1LegacyMode.description: Enabling v1_legacy_mode may prevent you from using features provided by the v2 API.

WorkspaceUpdateParameters.description: The parameters for updating a machine learning workspace.

properties.description: The properties that the machine learning workspace will be updated with.

sku.description: Optional. This field is required to be implemented by the RP because AML is supporting more than one tier

tags.description: The resource tags for the machine learning workspace.

WorkspaceForceToPurgeParameter.description: Flag to indicate delete is a purge request.

ConnectionName.description: Friendly name of the workspace connection

RuleName.description: Name of the workspace managed network outbound rule

ProxyApiVersion.description: Api version used by proxy call
